translations.chinese: 項籍者，下相人也，字羽。
translations.literal: Xiang Ji one, Xia Xiang person also, style Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji was from Xiayi. His style name was Yu.

translations.idiomatic: His youngest uncle Xiang Liang—Liang's father was the Chu general Xiang Yan, who was executed by the Qin general Wang Jian.

translations.literal: Xiang clan generation generation was Chu generals, enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore surname Xiang clan.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiang clan for generations served as Chu generals, and were enfeoffed at Xiang, hence they took the surname Xiang.

translations.literal: Xiang Ji young time, studied writing not succeed, left studied sword, again not succeed.
translations.idiomatic: When Xiang Ji was young, he studied writing but did not succeed, so he left to study swordsmanship, but again did not succeed.

context.next: 項梁怒之。

translations.chinese: 項梁怒之。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang angered him.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang was angered by this.

context.previous: 項籍少時，學書不成，去學劍，又不成。

translations.chinese: 籍曰：「書足以記名姓而已。
translations.literal: Ji said: 'Writing sufficient record names surnames only.
translations.idiomatic: Ji said, "Writing is sufficient to record names and surnames. That is enough."

context.previous: 項梁怒之。
context.next: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」

translations.chinese: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」
translations.literal: Sword one person enemy, not sufficient learn, learn ten thousand people enemy.'
translations.idiomatic: "Swordsmanship is for fighting one enemy; it is not worth learning. I want to learn to fight ten thousand enemies."

context.previous: 籍曰：「書足以記名姓而已。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Liang then taught Ji military methods, Ji greatly happy, roughly knew its meaning, moreover not willing completely learn.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Xiang Liang taught Ji military methods. Ji was greatly delighted, and roughly understood their meaning, though he was unwilling to study them completely.

context.previous: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang once had a case in Queyang, and requested that Cao Jiu, the clerk of the Qi prison, write a letter to reach Sima Xin, the clerk of the Queyang prison, so that with former matters he could resolve it.

context.previous: 於是項梁乃教籍兵法，籍大喜，略知其意，又不肯竟學。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang killed person, with Ji avoided enemies at Wu Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang killed a man, and together with Ji fled enemies to Wuzhong.

context.previous: 項梁嘗有櫟陽逮，乃請蘄獄掾曹咎書抵櫟陽獄掾司馬欣，以故事得已。

translations.literal: Wu Zhong worthy scholars grand masters all came out Xiang Liang below.
translations.idiomatic: The worthy scholars and grand masters of Wuzhong all came under Xiang Liang.

context.previous: 項梁殺人，與籍避仇於吳中。

translations.chinese: 每吳中有大繇役及喪，項梁常為主辦，陰以兵法部勒賓客及子弟，以是知其能。
translations.literal: Every Wu Zhong had great labor service and mourning, Xiang Liang constantly was main manager, secretly with military methods organized guests and younger brothers, with this knew his ability.
translations.idiomatic: Every time there was a great labor service or funeral in Wuzhong, Xiang Liang would always serve as the main manager, secretly using military methods to organize the guests and younger brothers, so that his ability was known.

context.previous: 吳中賢士大夫皆出項梁下。

translations.literal: Qin Beginning Emperor toured Kui Ji, crossed Zhe Jiang, Liang with Ji together observed.
translations.idiomatic: When the First Emperor toured Kuaiji, crossing the Zhejiang River, Liang and Ji both observed him.

translations.chinese: 籍曰：「彼可取而代也。」
translations.literal: Ji said: 'That can take and replace also.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji said, "That one can be taken and replaced."

translations.chinese: 梁掩其口，曰：「毋妄言，族矣！」
translations.literal: Liang covered his mouth, said: 'Not reckless speak, clan perished!'
translations.idiomatic: Liang covered his mouth, saying, "Do not speak recklessly—the clan will perish!"

context.previous: 籍曰：「彼可取而代也。」
context.next: 梁以此奇籍。

translations.chinese: 梁以此奇籍。
translations.literal: Liang with this considered Ji extraordinary.
translations.idiomatic: Liang considered Ji extraordinary because of this.

context.previous: 梁掩其口，曰：「毋妄言，族矣！」
context.next: 籍長八尺餘，力能扛鼎，才氣過人，雖吳中子弟皆已憚籍矣。

translations.literal: Ji tall eight chi remainder, strength could lift tripod, talent spirit surpassed people, though Wu Zhong younger brothers all already feared Ji already.
translations.idiomatic: Ji was over eight chi tall, could lift a tripod with his strength, his talent and spirit surpassed others, though even the younger brothers of Wuzhong all already feared Ji.

context.previous: 梁以此奇籍。

translations.chinese: 秦二世元年七月，陳涉等起大澤中。
translations.literal: Qin Second Generation first year seventh month, Chen She etc. rose great marsh middle.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of the Second Qin Emperor, in the seventh month, Chen She and others rose in the great marsh.

context.next: 其九月，會稽守通謂梁曰：「江西皆反，此亦天亡秦之時也。

translations.chinese: 其九月，會稽守通謂梁曰：「江西皆反，此亦天亡秦之時也。
translations.literal: Its ninth month, Kui Ji governor Tong said to Liang: 'Jiang west all rebelled, this also heaven perished Qin time also.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, the Kuaiji governor Tong said to Liang, "All west of the Jiang have rebelled—this is the time when Heaven will destroy Qin."

translations.literal: I heard first then control people, later then by people controlled.
translations.idiomatic: "I have heard that first one controls others, later one is controlled by others."

context.next: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」

translations.chinese: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」
translations.literal: I wish dispatch troops, make duke and Huan Chu general.'
translations.idiomatic: "I wish to dispatch troops—make you duke and Huan Chu the general."

context.previous: 吾聞先即制人，後則為人所制。
context.next: 是時桓楚亡在澤中。

translations.literal: This time Huan Chu fled in marsh middle.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Huan Chu was hiding in the marsh.

context.previous: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」
context.next: 梁曰：「桓楚亡，人莫知其處，獨籍知之耳。」

translations.chinese: 梁曰：「桓楚亡，人莫知其處，獨籍知之耳。」
translations.literal: Liang said: 'Huan Chu fled, people none know his place, only Ji knows it ear.'
translations.idiomatic: Liang said, "Huan Chu has fled; no one knows his place, only Ji knows it."

translations.idiomatic: Liang went out and warned Ji to hold a sword and wait outside.

context.next: 梁復入，與守坐，曰：「請召籍，使受命召桓楚。」

translations.chinese: 梁復入，與守坐，曰：「請召籍，使受命召桓楚。」
translations.literal: Liang again entered, with governor sat, said: 'Please summon Ji, make receive command summon Huan Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: Liang entered again and sat with the governor, saying, "Please summon Ji, so he may receive the command to summon Huan Chu."

context.previous: 梁乃出，誡籍持劍居外待。
context.next: 守曰：「諾。」

translations.chinese: 守曰：「諾。」
translations.literal: Governor said: 'Agreed.'
translations.idiomatic: The governor said, "Agreed."

context.previous: 梁復入，與守坐，曰：「請召籍，使受命召桓楚。」

translations.idiomatic: In a moment, Liang winked at Ji, saying, "You can act now!"

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang held the governor's head and wore his seal ribbons.

translations.literal: Gate below greatly startled, disturbed chaotic, Ji what struck killed several ten hundred people.

translations.idiomatic: Everyone in the office was terrified and submitted, none dared to rise.

context.previous: 門下大驚，擾亂，籍所擊殺數十百人。
context.next: 梁乃召故所知豪吏，諭以所為起大事，遂舉吳中兵。

translations.idiomatic: Liang then summoned the heroic officials he formerly knew, explained what he was doing to raise great matters, and then raised the troops of Wuzhong.

context.previous: 一府中皆慴伏，莫敢起。

translations.idiomatic: Liang deployed the heroic outstanding men of Wuzhong as company commanders, scouts, and adjutants.

context.next: 梁曰：「前時某喪使公主某事，不能辦，以此不任用公。」

translations.literal: Liang said: 'Former time certain mourning made you duke certain matters, could not manage, with this not employed you.'
translations.idiomatic: Liang said, "Previously, when there was a certain funeral, I made you duke handle certain matters, and you could not manage them, so with this I do not employ you."

context.previous: 有一人不得用，自言於梁。
context.next: 眾乃皆伏。

translations.chinese: 眾乃皆伏。
translations.literal: Crowd then all submitted.
translations.idiomatic: The crowd then all submitted.

context.next: 於是梁為會稽守，籍為裨將，徇下縣。

translations.literal: Thereupon Liang was Kui Ji governor, Ji was assistant general, toured lower counties.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Liang became the Kuaiji governor, Ji became the assistant general, and toured the lower counties.

translations.literal: Guang Ling person Zhao Ping at this for Chen king toured Guang Ling, not yet able submit.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ping of Guangling at this time toured Guangling for the Chen king, but could not submit it.

translations.idiomatic: He heard that the Chen king was defeated and fled, and Qin troops were about to arrive, so he crossed the Jiang and forged the Chen king's command, appointing Liang as the Chu king's supreme pillar of state.

context.previous: 廣陵人召平於是為陳王徇廣陵，未能下。
context.next: 曰：「江東已定，急引兵西擊秦。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Jiang east already settled, urgently lead troops west strike Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: He said, "Jiangdong is already settled—urgently lead troops west to strike Qin."

translations.literal: Heard Chen Ying already submitted Dong Yang, made envoy wished with connect harmony together west.

context.next: 陳嬰者，故東陽令史，居縣中，素信謹，稱為長者。

translations.literal: Chen Ying one, former Dong Yang magistrate secretary, resided county middle, originally trustworthy careful, called elder.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Ying was formerly the Dongyang magistrate's secretary. He resided in the county and was originally trustworthy and careful, called an elder.

context.next: 東陽少年殺其令，相聚數千人，欲置長，無適用，乃請陳嬰。

translations.idiomatic: The Dongyang youths killed their magistrate, gathered several thousand people together, wished to establish a leader, but none were suitable, so they requested Chen Ying.

translations.chinese: 嬰謝不能，遂彊立嬰為長，縣中從者得二萬人。
translations.literal: Ying declined could not, then strongly established Ying as leader, county middle followers obtained twenty thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: Ying declined that he could not, but they strongly established Ying as leader, and the county followers obtained twenty thousand people.

translations.literal: Youths wished establish Ying then as king, different army dark heads specially rose.
translations.idiomatic: The youths wished to establish Ying as king then, with a different army of dark-headed soldiers specially rising.

context.next: 陳嬰母謂嬰曰：「自我為汝家婦，未嘗聞汝先古之有貴者。

translations.idiomatic: Chen Ying's mother said to Ying, "From when I became your family's woman, I have never heard that your ancestors had noble ones."

context.next: 今暴得大名，不祥。

translations.literal: Now suddenly obtained great name, not auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Now suddenly obtained great name, not auspicious. (translated).

translations.literal: Not as good as have belonging, matters succeed still obtain enfeoff marquis, matters fail easy to flee, not world what points name also.'
translations.idiomatic: Not as good as have belonging, matters succeed still obtain enfeoff marquis, matters fail easy to flee, not world what points name also.' (translated).

context.next: 嬰乃不敢為王。

translations.literal: Ying then not dared be king.
translations.idiomatic: Ying then not dared be king. (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Now battle can victory, Gao must quickly envy my merit; (translated).

translations.literal: Formerly Qin extinguished Qi Wang Jian grandson Tian An, Xiang Yu just crossing river rescued Zhao, Tian An submitted Jibei several cities, led his troops surrendered Xiang Yu, therefore established An as Jibei Wang, capital Bo Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly Qin extinguished Qi Wang Jian grandson Tian An, Xiang Yu just crossing river rescued Zhao, Tian An submitted Jibei several cities, led his troops surrendered Xiang Yu, therefore established An as Jibei Wang, capital Bo Yang. (translated).

translations.literal: Tian Rong, several times betrayed Xiang Liang, moreover not willing lead troops follow Chu strike Qin, with reason not enfeoffed.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong, several times betrayed Xiang Liang, moreover not willing lead troops follow Chu strike Qin, with reason not enfeoffed. (translated).

translations.literal: Cheng'an Jun Chen Yu abandoned general seal left, not followed enter passes, yet originally heard his worthy, had merit to Zhao, heard he at Nanpi, therefore accordingly ring enfeoffed three counties.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng'an Jun Chen Yu abandoned general seal left, not followed enter passes, yet originally heard his worthy, had merit to Zhao, heard he at Nanpi, therefore accordingly ring enfeoffed three counties. (translated).

translations.literal: Fan Jun general Mei Dun merit many, therefore enfeoffed one hundred thousand households marquis.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Jun general Mei Dun merit many, therefore enfeoffed one hundred thousand households marquis. (translated).

translations.literal: Xiang Wang self established as Western Chu Hegemon King, ruled nine commanderies, capital Pengcheng.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang self established as Western Chu Hegemon King, ruled nine commanderies, capital Pengcheng. (translated).

translations.chinese: 漢之元年四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。
translations.literal: Han first year fourth month, feudal lords dismissed Xi below, each went to their states.
translations.idiomatic: Han first year fourth month, feudal lords dismissed Xi below, each went to their states. (translated).

context.next: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang sent him out to state, made people move Righteous Emperor, said: 'Ancient emperors territory thousand li, must reside upstream.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang sent him out to state, made people move Righteous Emperor, said: 'Ancient emperors territory thousand li, must reside upstream.' (translated).

translations.literal: Then made envoys move Righteous Emperor Changsha Chen county.
translations.idiomatic: Then made envoys move Righteous Emperor Changsha Chen county. (translated).

translations.literal: Urged Righteous Emperor go, his ministers gradually gradually betrayed him, then secretly ordered Hengshan, Linjiang Wang strike kill him Jiang middle.
translations.idiomatic: Urged Righteous Emperor go, his ministers gradually gradually betrayed him, then secretly ordered Hengshan, Linjiang Wang strike kill him Jiang middle. (translated).

translations.literal: Han Wang Cheng had no military merit, Xiang Wang not made him go to state, with him together arrived Pengcheng, abolished to marquis, then moreover killed him.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang Cheng had no military merit, Xiang Wang not made him go to state, with him together arrived Pengcheng, abolished to marquis, then moreover killed him. (translated).

translations.literal: Zang Tu went to state, took advantage expelled Han Guang to Liaodong, Guang not listened, Tu struck killed Guang Wuzhong,
translations.idiomatic: Zang Tu went to state, took advantage expelled Han Guang to Liaodong, Guang not listened, Tu struck killed Guang Wuzhong, (translated).

translations.literal: Tian Rong heard Xiang Yu moved Qi Wang Shi Jiaodong, and established Qi general Tian Du as Qi Wang, then greatly angered, not willing send Qi Wang to Jiaodong, took advantage with Qi rebelled, welcomed struck Tian Du.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong heard Xiang Yu moved Qi Wang Shi Jiaodong, and established Qi general Tian Du as Qi Wang, then greatly angered, not willing send Qi Wang to Jiaodong, took advantage with Qi rebelled, welcomed struck Tian Du. (translated).

context.next: 田都走楚。

translations.literal: Tian Du fled to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Du fled to Chu. (translated).

context.previous: 田榮聞項羽徙齊王市膠東，而立齊將田都為齊王，乃大怒，不肯遣齊王之膠東，因以齊反，迎擊田都。
context.next: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。

translations.chinese: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。
translations.literal: Qi Wang Shi feared Xiang Wang, then fled to Jiaodong took state.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Wang Shi feared Xiang Wang, then fled to Jiaodong took state. (translated).

translations.literal: Tian Rong angered, pursued struck killed him Jimo.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong angered, pursued struck killed him Jimo. (translated).

translations.literal: Rong took advantage self established as Qi Wang, and west killed struck Jibei Wang Tian An, united ruled three Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Rong took advantage self established as Qi Wang, and west killed struck Jibei Wang Tian An, united ruled three Qi. (translated).

translations.literal: Rong gave Peng Yue general seal, ordered rebel Liang lands.
translations.idiomatic: Rong gave Peng Yue general seal, ordered rebel Liang lands. (translated).

translations.chinese: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。
translations.literal: Chen Yu secretly sent Zhang Tong, Xia Shuo persuaded Qi Wang Tian Rong said: 'Xiang Yu was world steward, not fair.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu secretly sent Zhang Tong, Xia Shuo persuaded Qi Wang Tian Rong said: 'Xiang Yu was world steward, not fair. (translated).

translations.chinese: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。
translations.literal: Now completely king former kings at ugly lands, and king his ministers various generals good lands, expelled their former lord Zhao Wang, moreover north resided Dai, Yu considered not possible.
translations.idiomatic: Now completely king former kings at ugly lands, and king his ministers various generals good lands, expelled their former lord Zhao Wang, moreover north resided Dai, Yu considered not possible. (translated).

context.previous: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。
context.next: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」

translations.chinese: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」
translations.literal: Heard great king raised troops, moreover not listened not righteous, wished great king supplied Yu troops, requested with strike Changshan, to restore Zhao Wang, requested with state as shield barrier.'
translations.idiomatic: Heard great king raised troops, moreover not listened not righteous, wished great king supplied Yu troops, requested with strike Changshan, to restore Zhao Wang, requested with state as shield barrier.' (translated).

translations.literal: Qi Wang permitted it, took advantage sent troops to Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Wang permitted it, took advantage sent troops to Zhao. (translated).

context.previous: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」
context.next: 陳餘悉發三縣兵，與齊并力擊常山，大破之。

translations.chinese: 陳餘悉發三縣兵，與齊并力擊常山，大破之。
translations.literal: Chen Yu completely dispatched three counties troops, with Qi combined strength struck Changshan, greatly defeated it.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu completely dispatched three counties troops, with Qi combined strength struck Changshan, greatly defeated it. (translated).

context.previous: 齊王許之，因遣兵之趙。
context.next: 張耳走歸漢。

translations.literal: Zhang Er fled and returned to Han.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Er fled and returned to Han. (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu welcomed former Zhao Wang Xie from Dai, returned him Zhao. (translated).

translations.literal: Zhao Wang took advantage established Chen Yu as Dai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Wang took advantage established Chen Yu as Dai Wang. (translated).

context.previous: 陳餘迎故趙王歇於代，反之趙。

translations.chinese: 是時，漢還定三秦。
translations.literal: At this time, Han returned pacified three Qin.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Han returned pacified three Qin. (translated).

context.next: 項羽聞漢王皆已并關中，且東，齊、趙叛之：大怒。

translations.chinese: 項羽聞漢王皆已并關中，且東，齊、趙叛之：大怒。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu heard Han Wang all already united Guanzhong, moreover east, Qi, Zhao rebelled him: greatly angered.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu heard Han Wang all already united Guanzhong, moreover east, Qi, Zhao rebelled him: greatly angered. (translated).

translations.literal: Then with former Wu magistrate Zheng Chang as Han Wang, to resist Han.
translations.idiomatic: Then with former Wu magistrate Zheng Chang as Han Wang, to resist Han. (translated).

context.previous: 項羽聞漢王皆已并關中，且東，齊、趙叛之：大怒。

translations.literal: Ordered Xiao Gong Jiao etc. strike Peng Yue.
translations.idiomatic: Ordered Xiao Gong Jiao etc. strike Peng Yue. (translated).

context.previous: 乃以故吳令鄭昌為韓王，以距漢。

translations.literal: Peng Yue defeated Xiao Gong Jiao etc.
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue defeated Xiao Gong Jiao etc. (translated).

translations.literal: Han sent Zhang Liang toured Han, then sent Xiang Wang letter said: 'Han Wang lost position, wished get Guanzhong, as agreement then stop, not dared east.'
translations.idiomatic: Han sent Zhang Liang toured Han, then sent Xiang Wang letter said: 'Han Wang lost position, wished get Guanzhong, as agreement then stop, not dared east.' (translated).

translations.literal: Again with Qi, Liang rebellion letters sent Xiang Wang said: 'Qi wished with Zhao united extinguish Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: Again with Qi, Liang rebellion letters sent Xiang Wang said: 'Qi wished with Zhao united extinguish Chu.' (translated).

context.previous: 漢使張良徇韓，乃遺項王書曰：「漢王失職，欲得關中，如約即止，不敢東。」
context.next: 楚以此故無西意，而北擊齊。

translations.literal: Chu with this reason had no west intention, and north struck Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Chu with this reason had no west intention, and north struck Qi. (translated).

context.next: 徵兵九江王布。

translations.chinese: 徵兵九江王布。
translations.literal: Conscripted troops Jiujiang Wang Bu.
translations.idiomatic: Conscripted troops Jiujiang Wang Bu. (translated).

context.previous: 楚以此故無西意，而北擊齊。
context.next: 布稱疾不往，使將將數千人行。

translations.literal: Bu claimed illness not went, made general led several thousand people went.
translations.idiomatic: Bu claimed illness not went, made general led several thousand people went. (translated).

context.next: 項王由此怨布也。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang from this resented Bu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang from this resented Bu. (translated).

context.previous: 布稱疾不往，使將將數千人行。
context.next: 漢之二年冬，項羽遂北至城陽，田榮亦將兵會戰。

translations.chinese: 漢之二年冬，項羽遂北至城陽，田榮亦將兵會戰。
translations.literal: Han second year winter, Xiang Yu then north arrived Chengyang, Tian Rong also led troops assembled battle.
translations.idiomatic: Han second year winter, Xiang Yu then north arrived Chengyang, Tian Rong also led troops assembled battle. (translated).

context.previous: 項王由此怨布也。
context.next: 田榮不勝，走至平原，平原民殺之。

translations.literal: Tian Rong not victorious, fled to Pingyuan, Pingyuan people killed him.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong not victorious, fled to Pingyuan, Pingyuan people killed him. (translated).

translations.literal: Then north burned razed Qi city walls houses, all buried Tian Rong surrendered soldiers, bound captured their old weak women.
translations.idiomatic: Then north burned razed Qi city walls houses, all buried Tian Rong surrendered soldiers, bound captured their old weak women. (translated).

context.previous: 田榮不勝，走至平原，平原民殺之。

translations.literal: Toured Qi arrived Beihai, much destroyed extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: Toured Qi arrived Beihai, much destroyed extinguished. (translated).

context.previous: 遂北燒夷齊城郭室屋，皆阬田榮降卒，系虜其老弱婦女。
context.next: 齊人相聚而叛之。

translations.idiomatic: Qi people gathered together rebelled him. (translated).

context.previous: 徇齊至北海，多所殘滅。
context.next: 於是田榮弟田橫收齊亡卒得數萬人，反城陽。

translations.literal: Therefore Tian Rong younger brother Tian Heng gathered Qi scattered soldiers got several ten thousand people, rebelled Chengyang.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Tian Rong younger brother Tian Heng gathered Qi scattered soldiers got several ten thousand people, rebelled Chengyang. (translated).

context.previous: 齊人相聚而叛之。
context.next: 項王因留，連戰未能下。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang took advantage stayed, continuous battles could not conquer.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang took advantage stayed, continuous battles could not conquer. (translated).

translations.chinese: 春，漢王部五諸侯兵，凡五十六萬人，東伐楚。
translations.literal: Spring, Han Wang commanded five feudal lords troops, altogether five hundred sixty thousand people, east attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Spring, Han Wang commanded five feudal lords troops, altogether five hundred sixty thousand people, east attacked Chu. (translated).

context.next: 項王聞之，即令諸將擊齊，而自以精兵三萬人南從魯出胡陵。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang heard it, immediately ordered various generals strike Qi, and self with elite troops thirty thousand people south from Lu emerged Huling.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang heard it, immediately ordered various generals strike Qi, and self with elite troops thirty thousand people south from Lu emerged Huling. (translated).

context.previous: 春，漢王部五諸侯兵，凡五十六萬人，東伐楚。
context.next: 四月，漢皆已入彭城，收其貨寶美人，日置酒高會。

translations.literal: Fourth month, Han all already entered Pengcheng, collected their goods treasures beauties, daily arranged wine grand gatherings.

translations.idiomatic: Chu army greatly disordered, ruined scattered, and Han Wang then got with several ten riders escaped went, wished pass Pei, collect family and west; (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Chu cavalry pursued Han Wang, Han Wang urgent, pushed fell Xiao Hui, Lu Yuan cart below, Teng Gong often descended collected carried them. (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Like this three times. (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Said: 'Though urgent cannot hurry, how abandon them?' (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Sought Tai Gong, Lu Hou not met. (translated).

translations.literal: Fan Zeng greatly angered, said: 'World affairs greatly settled, lord king self do it.

translations.literal: Wish grant remains return common soldier ranks.'

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang approved his words, then pardoned Waihuang should bury alive ones. (translated).

context.previous: 從此以東，梁地十餘城皆恐，莫肯下矣。」

translations.literal: East arrived Suiyang, heard it all competed submitted Xiang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: East arrived Suiyang, heard it all competed submitted Xiang Wang. (translated).

translations.literal: Han indeed several times provoked Chu army battle, Chu army not came out.
translations.idiomatic: Han indeed several times provoked Chu army battle, Chu army not came out. (translated).

translations.literal: Sent people insulted them, five six days, grand marshal angered, crossed troops Si water.
translations.idiomatic: Sent people insulted them, five six days, grand marshal angered, crossed troops Si water. (translated).

translations.chinese: 士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國貨賂。
translations.literal: Soldiers half crossed, Han struck them, greatly defeated Chu army, completely got Chu state goods bribes.
translations.idiomatic: Soldiers half crossed, Han struck them, greatly defeated Chu army, completely got Chu state goods bribes. (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Grand marshal Jiu, chief clerk Yi, Sai Wang Xin all self cut throats Si water on. (translated).

translations.chinese: 大司馬咎者，故蘄獄掾，長史欣亦故櫟陽獄吏，兩人嘗有德於項梁，是以項王信任之。
translations.literal: Grand marshal Jiu, formerly Qi prison clerk, chief clerk Xin also formerly Queyang prison official, two people once had virtue to Xiang Liang, therefore Xiang Wang trusted them.
translations.idiomatic: Grand marshal Jiu, formerly Qi prison clerk, chief clerk Xin also formerly Queyang prison official, two people once had virtue to Xiang Liang, therefore Xiang Wang trusted them. (translated).

translations.literal: At this time, Xiang Wang at Suiyang, heard Haichun Hou army defeated, then led troops returned.

context.previous: 大司馬咎者，故蘄獄掾，長史欣亦故櫟陽獄吏，兩人嘗有德於項梁，是以項王信任之。
context.next: 漢軍方圍鐘離眛於滎陽東，項王至，漢軍畏楚，盡走險阻。

translations.literal: Han army just surrounding Zhongli Mo at Xingyang east, Xiang Wang arrived, Han army feared Chu, all fled dangerous places.
translations.idiomatic: Han army just surrounding Zhongli Mo at Xingyang east, Xiang Wang arrived, Han army feared Chu, all fled dangerous places. (translated).

translations.literal: At this time, Han troops flourishing food plentiful, Xiang Wang troops exhausted food cut off.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Han troops flourishing food plentiful, Xiang Wang troops exhausted food cut off. (translated).

context.next: 漢遣陸賈說項王，請太公，項王弗聽。

translations.chinese: 漢遣陸賈說項王，請太公，項王弗聽。
translations.literal: Han sent Lu Jia persuaded Xiang Wang, requested Tai Gong, Xiang Wang not listened.
translations.idiomatic: Han sent Lu Jia persuaded Xiang Wang, requested Tai Gong, Xiang Wang not listened. (translated).

context.previous: 是時，漢兵盛食多，項王兵罷食絕。

translations.literal: Han Wang again sent Hou Gong go persuaded Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang then with Han agreed, middle divided world, divided Honggou west as Han, Honggou east as Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang again sent Hou Gong go persuaded Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang then with Han agreed, middle divided world, divided Honggou west as Han, Honggou east as Chu. (translated).

translations.literal: Xiang Wang permitted it, immediately returned Han Wang parents wives children.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang permitted it, immediately returned Han Wang parents wives children. (translated).

context.previous: 漢王復使侯公往說項王，項王乃與漢約，中分天下，割鴻溝以西者為漢，鴻溝而東者為楚。

translations.literal: The army all called 'ten thousand years.'

context.previous: 項王許之，即歸漢王父母妻子。

translations.idiomatic: Han Wang then enfeoffed Hou Gong as Pingguo Jun. (translated).

context.previous: 軍皆呼萬歲。

translations.literal: Hid not willing again see.
translations.idiomatic: Hid not willing again see. (translated).

context.previous: 漢王乃封侯公為平國君。

translations.chinese: 曰：「此天下辯士，所居傾國，故號為平國君。」
translations.literal: Said: 'This world eloquent scholar, where he resides overthrows state, therefore titled Pingguo Jun.'
translations.idiomatic: Said: 'This world eloquent scholar, where he resides overthrows state, therefore titled Pingguo Jun.' (translated).

context.previous: 匿弗肯復見。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang already agreed, then led troops withdrew and east returned. (translated).

context.previous: 曰：「此天下辯士，所居傾國，故號為平國君。」

translations.literal: Han wished west return, Zhang Liang, Chen Ping advised said: 'Han has world too half, and feudal lords all attach to it.
translations.idiomatic: Han wished west return, Zhang Liang, Chen Ping advised said: 'Han has world too half, and feudal lords all attach to it. (translated).

translations.literal: Chu troops exhausted food exhausted, this heaven destroy Chu time, better take advantage opportunity and then take it.
translations.idiomatic: Chu troops exhausted food exhausted, this heaven destroy Chu time, better take advantage opportunity and then take it. (translated).

context.previous: 漢欲西歸，張良、陳平說曰：「漢有天下太半，而諸侯皆附之。

translations.idiomatic: Now release not strike, this called 'raise tiger self leave calamity.' (translated).

context.previous: 楚兵罷食盡，此天亡楚之時也，不如因其機而遂取之。

translations.literal: Han King listened to it.

context.previous: 漢王復入壁，深塹而自守。
context.next: 對曰：「楚兵且破，信、越未有分地，其不至固宜。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Chu troops about broken, Xin, Yue not yet have divided lands, their not coming certainly appropriate.
translations.idiomatic: Replied said: 'Chu troops about broken, Xin, Yue not yet have divided lands, their not coming certainly appropriate. (translated).

translations.literal: Lord king able with them share divide world, now can immediately achieve.
translations.idiomatic: Lord king able with them share divide world, now can immediately achieve. (translated).

context.previous: 對曰：「楚兵且破，信、越未有分地，其不至固宜。

translations.literal: If not able, matters not yet knowable.

translations.literal: Lord king able self Chen east reaching sea, completely give to Han Xin;
translations.idiomatic: Lord king able self Chen east reaching sea, completely give to Han Xin; (translated).

context.previous: 即不能，事未可知也。
context.next: 睢陽以北至穀城，以與彭越：使各自為戰，則楚易敗也。」

translations.chinese: 睢陽以北至穀城，以與彭越：使各自為戰，則楚易敗也。」
translations.literal: Suiyang north to Gucheng, to give Peng Yue: make each self fight, then Chu easy defeat.'
translations.idiomatic: Suiyang north to Gucheng, to give Peng Yue: make each self fight, then Chu easy defeat.' (translated).

context.previous: 君王能自陳以東傅海，盡與韓信；
context.next: 漢王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Han King said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: Han King said: 'Good.' (translated).

translations.literal: Therefore then sent envoys told Han Xin, Peng Yue said: 'Combine strength strike Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore then sent envoys told Han Xin, Peng Yue said: 'Combine strength strike Chu. (translated).

context.previous: 漢王曰：「善。」
context.next: 楚破，自陳以東傅海與齊王，睢陽以北至穀城與彭相國。」

translations.chinese: 楚破，自陳以東傅海與齊王，睢陽以北至穀城與彭相國。」
translations.literal: Chu broken, self Chen east reaching sea give Qi Wang, Suiyang north to Gucheng give Peng chancellor.'
translations.idiomatic: Chu broken, self Chen east reaching sea give Qi Wang, Suiyang north to Gucheng give Peng chancellor.' (translated).

context.previous: 於是乃發使者告韓信、彭越曰：「并力擊楚。
context.next: 使者至，韓信、彭越皆報曰：「請今進兵。」

translations.idiomatic: Envoys arrived, Han Xin, Peng Yue all replied said: 'Request now advance troops.' (translated).

context.next: 韓信乃從齊往，劉賈軍從壽春并行，屠城父，至垓下。

translations.idiomatic: Grand marshal Zhou Yin rebelled Chu, with Shu slaughtered Liu, raised Jiujiang troops, followed Liu Jia, Peng Yue all assembled Gaixia, went to Xiang Wang. (translated).

translations.literal: Xiang Wang army fortified Gaixia, troops few food exhausted, Han army and feudal lords troops surrounded it several layers.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang army fortified Gaixia, troops few food exhausted, Han army and feudal lords troops surrounded it several layers. (translated).

translations.literal: Night heard Han army four sides all Chu songs, Xiang Wang then greatly startled said: 'Han all already got Chu?
translations.idiomatic: Night heard Han army four sides all Chu songs, Xiang Wang then greatly startled said: 'Han all already got Chu? (translated).

context.previous: 項王軍壁垓下，兵少食盡，漢軍及諸侯兵圍之數重。
context.next: 是何楚人之多也！」

translations.literal: What Chu people many!'
translations.idiomatic: What Chu people many!' (translated).

context.previous: 夜聞漢軍四面皆楚歌，項王乃大驚曰：「漢皆已得楚乎？
context.next: 項王則夜起，飲帳中。

translations.chinese: 項王則夜起，飲帳中。
translations.literal: Xiang Wang then night rose, drank in tent.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then night rose, drank in tent. (translated).

context.previous: 是何楚人之多也！」
context.next: 有美人名虞，常幸從；

translations.literal: Had beauty named Yu, constantly favored followed;
translations.idiomatic: Had beauty named Yu, constantly favored followed; (translated).

context.previous: 項王則夜起，飲帳中。
context.next: 駿馬名騅，常騎之。

translations.literal: Fine horse named Zhui, constantly rode it.
translations.idiomatic: Fine horse named Zhui, constantly rode it. (translated).

context.previous: 有美人名虞，常幸從；
context.next: 於是項王乃悲歌慨，自為詩曰：「力拔山兮氣蓋世，時不利兮騅不逝。

translations.chinese: 於是項王乃悲歌慨，自為詩曰：「力拔山兮氣蓋世，時不利兮騅不逝。
translations.literal: Therefore Xiang Wang then sorrowful song heroic, self made poem said: 'Strength uproot mountain vigor cover world, time unfavorable Zhui not go.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Xiang Wang then sorrowful song heroic, self made poem said: 'Strength uproot mountain vigor cover world, time unfavorable Zhui not go. (translated).

context.previous: 駿馬名騅，常騎之。

translations.literal: Zhui not go what can do, Yu Yu what do!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhui not go what can do, Yu Yu what do!' (translated).

context.previous: 於是項王乃悲歌慨，自為詩曰：「力拔山兮氣蓋世，時不利兮騅不逝。

translations.literal: Sang several stanzas, beauty harmonized it.
translations.idiomatic: Sang several stanzas, beauty harmonized it. (translated).

context.previous: 騅不逝兮可柰何，虞兮虞兮柰若何！」

translations.idiomatic: Therefore Xiang Wang then mounted horse, commanded brave warriors riding followers eight hundred more people, straight night broke encirclement south out, galloped fled. (translated).

translations.literal: Dawn, Han army then became aware, ordered cavalry general Guan Ying with five thousand riders pursue him.

context.previous: 於是項王乃上馬騎，麾下壯士騎從者八百餘人，直夜潰圍南出，馳走。

translations.chinese: 項王渡淮，騎能屬者百餘人耳。
translations.literal: Xiang Wang crossed Huai, riders able follow one hundred more people only.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang crossed Huai, riders able follow one hundred more people only. (translated).

context.previous: 平明，漢軍乃覺之，令騎將灌嬰以五千騎追之。

translations.chinese: 項王至陰陵，迷失道，問一田父，田父紿曰「左」。
translations.literal: Xiang Wang arrived Yinling, lost way, asked one farmer, farmer deceived said 'left'.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang arrived Yinling, lost way, asked one farmer, farmer deceived said 'left'. (translated).

context.previous: 項王渡淮，騎能屬者百餘人耳。
context.next: 左，乃陷大澤中。

translations.chinese: 左，乃陷大澤中。
translations.literal: Left, then fell into great marsh.
translations.idiomatic: Left, then fell into great marsh. (translated).

context.previous: 項王至陰陵，迷失道，問一田父，田父紿曰「左」。
context.next: 以故漢追及之。

translations.chinese: 以故漢追及之。
translations.literal: Therefore Han pursued caught him.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Han pursued caught him. (translated).

context.previous: 左，乃陷大澤中。

translations.chinese: 項王乃復引兵而東，至東城，乃有二十八騎。
translations.literal: Xiang Wang then again led troops east, arrived Dongcheng, then had twenty eight riders.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then again led troops east, arrived Dongcheng, then had twenty eight riders. (translated).

context.previous: 以故漢追及之。
context.next: 漢騎追者數千人。

translations.chinese: 漢騎追者數千人。
translations.literal: Han riders pursuing several thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: Han riders pursuing several thousand people. (translated).

context.previous: 項王乃復引兵而東，至東城，乃有二十八騎。
context.next: 項王自度不得脫。

translations.chinese: 項王自度不得脫。
translations.literal: Xiang Wang self measured could not escape.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang self measured could not escape. (translated).

context.previous: 漢騎追者數千人。
context.next: 謂其騎曰：「吾起兵至今八歲矣，身七十餘戰，所當者破，所擊者服，未嘗敗北，遂霸有天下。

translations.chinese: 謂其騎曰：「吾起兵至今八歲矣，身七十餘戰，所當者破，所擊者服，未嘗敗北，遂霸有天下。
translations.literal: Said to his riders: 'I raised troops until now eight years, personally seventy more battles, what faced broken, what struck submitted, never defeated fled, then hegemon possessed world.
translations.idiomatic: Said to his riders: 'I raised troops until now eight years, personally seventy more battles, what faced broken, what struck submitted, never defeated fled, then hegemon possessed world. (translated).

context.previous: 項王自度不得脫。
context.next: 然今卒困於此，此天之亡我，非戰之罪也。

translations.chinese: 然今卒困於此，此天之亡我，非戰之罪也。
translations.literal: Yet now finally trapped here, this heaven destroys me, not battle crime.
translations.idiomatic: Yet now finally trapped here, this heaven destroys me, not battle crime. (translated).

context.previous: 謂其騎曰：「吾起兵至今八歲矣，身七十餘戰，所當者破，所擊者服，未嘗敗北，遂霸有天下。
context.next: 今日固決死，願為諸君快戰，必三勝之，為諸君潰圍，斬將，刈旗，令諸君知天亡我，非戰之罪也。」

translations.chinese: 今日固決死，願為諸君快戰，必三勝之，為諸君潰圍，斬將，刈旗，令諸君知天亡我，非戰之罪也。」
translations.literal: Today certainly decide death, wish for various lords satisfying battle, must three victories, for various lords break encirclement, behead generals, cut banners, make various lords know heaven destroys me, not battle crime.'
translations.idiomatic: Today certainly decide death, wish for various lords satisfying battle, must three victories, for various lords break encirclement, behead generals, cut banners, make various lords know heaven destroys me, not battle crime.' (translated).

context.previous: 然今卒困於此，此天之亡我，非戰之罪也。
context.next: 乃分其騎以為四隊，四向。

translations.chinese: 乃分其騎以為四隊，四向。
translations.literal: Then divided his riders into four teams, four directions.
translations.idiomatic: Then divided his riders into four teams, four directions. (translated).

context.previous: 今日固決死，願為諸君快戰，必三勝之，為諸君潰圍，斬將，刈旗，令諸君知天亡我，非戰之罪也。」
context.next: 漢軍圍之數重。

translations.chinese: 漢軍圍之數重。
translations.literal: Han army surrounded it several layers.
translations.idiomatic: Han army surrounded it several layers. (translated).

context.previous: 乃分其騎以為四隊，四向。
context.next: 項王謂其騎曰：「吾為公取彼一將。」

translations.chinese: 項王謂其騎曰：「吾為公取彼一將。」
translations.literal: Xiang Wang said to his riders: 'I for you take that one general.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang said to his riders: 'I for you take that one general.' (translated).

context.previous: 漢軍圍之數重。
context.next: 令四面騎馳下，期山東為三處。

translations.chinese: 令四面騎馳下，期山東為三處。
translations.literal: Ordered four sides riders gallop down, agreed east mountain as three places.
translations.idiomatic: Ordered four sides riders gallop down, agreed east mountain as three places. (translated).

context.previous: 項王謂其騎曰：「吾為公取彼一將。」
context.next: 於是項王大呼馳下，漢軍皆披靡，遂斬漢一將。

translations.chinese: 於是項王大呼馳下，漢軍皆披靡，遂斬漢一將。
translations.literal: Therefore Xiang Wang great shout galloped down, Han army all scattered, then beheaded Han one general.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Xiang Wang great shout galloped down, Han army all scattered, then beheaded Han one general. (translated).

context.previous: 令四面騎馳下，期山東為三處。
context.next: 是時，赤泉侯為騎將，追項王，項王瞋目而叱之，赤泉侯人馬俱驚，辟易數里與其騎會為三處。

translations.chinese: 是時，赤泉侯為騎將，追項王，項王瞋目而叱之，赤泉侯人馬俱驚，辟易數里與其騎會為三處。
translations.literal: At this time, Chiquan Hou was cavalry general, pursued Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang glared eyes berated him, Chiquan Hou person horse both startled, retreated several li with his riders assembled as three places.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Chiquan Hou was cavalry general, pursued Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang glared eyes berated him, Chiquan Hou person horse both startled, retreated several li with his riders assembled as three places. (translated).

context.previous: 於是項王大呼馳下，漢軍皆披靡，遂斬漢一將。
context.next: 漢軍不知項王所在，乃分軍為三，復圍之。

translations.chinese: 漢軍不知項王所在，乃分軍為三，復圍之。
translations.literal: Han army not know Xiang Wang location, then divided army into three, again surrounded them.
translations.idiomatic: Han army not know Xiang Wang location, then divided army into three, again surrounded them. (translated).

context.previous: 是時，赤泉侯為騎將，追項王，項王瞋目而叱之，赤泉侯人馬俱驚，辟易數里與其騎會為三處。
context.next: 項王乃馳，復斬漢一都尉，殺數十百人，復聚其騎，亡其兩騎耳。

translations.chinese: 項王乃馳，復斬漢一都尉，殺數十百人，復聚其騎，亡其兩騎耳。
translations.literal: Xiang Wang then galloped, again beheaded Han one commandery captain, killed several ten hundred people, again gathered his riders, lost his two riders only.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then galloped, again beheaded Han one commandery captain, killed several ten hundred people, again gathered his riders, lost his two riders only. (translated).

context.previous: 漢軍不知項王所在，乃分軍為三，復圍之。
context.next: 乃謂其騎曰：「何如？」

translations.chinese: 乃謂其騎曰：「何如？」
translations.literal: He then said to his riders: 'How is it?'
translations.idiomatic: He then said to his riders: 'How is it?' (translated).

context.previous: 項王乃馳，復斬漢一都尉，殺數十百人，復聚其騎，亡其兩騎耳。
context.next: 騎皆伏曰：「如大王言。」

translations.chinese: 騎皆伏曰：「如大王言。」
translations.literal: The riders all submitted and said: 'As the great king said.'
translations.idiomatic: The riders all submitted and said: 'As the great king said.' (translated).

context.previous: 乃謂其騎曰：「何如？」

translations.chinese: 於是項王乃欲東渡烏江。
translations.literal: Therefore Xiang Wang then wished east cross Wujiang.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Xiang Wang then wished east cross Wujiang. (translated).

context.next: 烏江亭長檥船待，謂項王曰：「江東雖小，地方千里，眾數十萬人，亦足王也。

translations.chinese: 烏江亭長檥船待，謂項王曰：「江東雖小，地方千里，眾數十萬人，亦足王也。
translations.literal: Wujiang pavilion chief moored boat waited, said to Xiang Wang: 'Jiangdong though small, territory thousand li, multitude several ten ten thousand people, also sufficient king.
translations.idiomatic: Wujiang pavilion chief moored boat waited, said to Xiang Wang: 'Jiangdong though small, territory thousand li, multitude several ten ten thousand people, also sufficient king. (translated).

context.previous: 於是項王乃欲東渡烏江。
context.next: 願大王急渡。

translations.chinese: 願大王急渡。
translations.literal: Wish great king urgently cross.
translations.idiomatic: Wish great king urgently cross. (translated).

context.previous: 烏江亭長檥船待，謂項王曰：「江東雖小，地方千里，眾數十萬人，亦足王也。
context.next: 今獨臣有船，漢軍至，無以渡。」

translations.chinese: 今獨臣有船，漢軍至，無以渡。」
translations.literal: Now only minister has boat, Han army arrives, nothing to cross.'
translations.idiomatic: Now only minister has boat, Han army arrives, nothing to cross.' (translated).

context.previous: 願大王急渡。
context.next: 項王笑曰：「天之亡我，我何渡為！

translations.chinese: 項王笑曰：「天之亡我，我何渡為！
translations.literal: Xiang Wang laughed said: 'Heaven destroys me, I what cross for!
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang laughed said: 'Heaven destroys me, I what cross for! (translated).

context.previous: 今獨臣有船，漢軍至，無以渡。」
context.next: 且籍與江東子弟八千人渡江而西，今無一人還，縱江東父兄憐而王我，我何面目見之？

translations.chinese: 且籍與江東子弟八千人渡江而西，今無一人還，縱江東父兄憐而王我，我何面目見之？
translations.literal: Moreover Ji with Jiangdong sons eight thousand crossed river west, now none one returns, even if Jiangdong fathers elders pity king me, I what face see them?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover Ji with Jiangdong sons eight thousand crossed river west, now none one returns, even if Jiangdong fathers elders pity king me, I what face see them? (translated).

context.previous: 項王笑曰：「天之亡我，我何渡為！
context.next: 縱彼不言，籍獨不愧於心乎？」

translations.chinese: 縱彼不言，籍獨不愧於心乎？」
translations.literal: Even if they not speak, Ji alone not ashamed in heart?'
translations.idiomatic: Even if they not speak, Ji alone not ashamed in heart?' (translated).

context.previous: 且籍與江東子弟八千人渡江而西，今無一人還，縱江東父兄憐而王我，我何面目見之？
context.next: 乃謂亭長曰：「吾知公長者。

translations.chinese: 乃謂亭長曰：「吾知公長者。
translations.literal: Then said to pavilion chief: 'I know you elder.
translations.idiomatic: Then said to pavilion chief: 'I know you elder. (translated).

context.previous: 縱彼不言，籍獨不愧於心乎？」
context.next: 吾騎此馬五歲，所當無敵，嘗一日行千里，不忍殺之，以賜公。」

translations.chinese: 吾騎此馬五歲，所當無敵，嘗一日行千里，不忍殺之，以賜公。」
translations.literal: I rode this horse five years, what faced no enemy, once one day traveled thousand li, not bear kill it, to bestow you.'
translations.idiomatic: I rode this horse five years, what faced no enemy, once one day traveled thousand li, not bear kill it, to bestow you.' (translated).

context.previous: 乃謂亭長曰：「吾知公長者。
context.next: 乃令騎皆下馬步行，持短兵接戰。

translations.chinese: 乃令騎皆下馬步行，持短兵接戰。
translations.literal: Then ordered riders all dismount walk, hold short weapons close battle.
translations.idiomatic: Then ordered riders all dismount walk, hold short weapons close battle. (translated).

context.previous: 吾騎此馬五歲，所當無敵，嘗一日行千里，不忍殺之，以賜公。」
context.next: 獨籍所殺漢軍數百人。

translations.chinese: 獨籍所殺漢軍數百人。
translations.literal: Alone Ji what killed Han army several hundred people.
translations.idiomatic: Alone Ji what killed Han army several hundred people. (translated).

context.previous: 乃令騎皆下馬步行，持短兵接戰。
context.next: 項王身亦被十餘創。

translations.chinese: 項王身亦被十餘創。
translations.literal: Xiang Wang body also suffered ten more wounds.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang body also suffered ten more wounds. (translated).

context.previous: 獨籍所殺漢軍數百人。
context.next: 顧見漢騎司馬呂馬童，曰：「若非吾故人乎？」

translations.chinese: 顧見漢騎司馬呂馬童，曰：「若非吾故人乎？」
translations.literal: Looked back saw Han cavalry adjutant Lu Matong, said: 'Are you not my old friend?'
translations.idiomatic: Looked back saw Han cavalry adjutant Lu Matong, said: 'Are you not my old friend?' (translated).

context.previous: 項王身亦被十餘創。
context.next: 馬童面之，指王翳曰：「此項王也。」

translations.chinese: 馬童面之，指王翳曰：「此項王也。」
translations.literal: Matong faced him, pointed to Wang Yi said: 'This is Xiang Wang.'
translations.idiomatic: Matong faced him, pointed to Wang Yi said: 'This is Xiang Wang.' (translated).

context.previous: 顧見漢騎司馬呂馬童，曰：「若非吾故人乎？」
context.next: 項王乃曰：「吾聞漢購我頭千金，邑萬戶，吾為若德。」

translations.chinese: 項王乃曰：「吾聞漢購我頭千金，邑萬戶，吾為若德。」
translations.literal: Xiang Wang then said: 'I heard Han offers my head thousand gold, fief ten thousand households, I for you virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then said: 'I heard Han offers my head thousand gold, fief ten thousand households, I for you virtue.' (translated).

context.previous: 馬童面之，指王翳曰：「此項王也。」
context.next: 乃自刎而死。

translations.chinese: 乃自刎而死。
translations.literal: Then self cut throat and died.
translations.idiomatic: Then self cut throat and died. (translated).

context.previous: 項王乃曰：「吾聞漢購我頭千金，邑萬戶，吾為若德。」
context.next: 王翳取其頭，餘騎相蹂踐爭項王，相殺者數十人。

translations.chinese: 王翳取其頭，餘騎相蹂踐爭項王，相殺者數十人。
translations.literal: Wang Yi took his head, remaining riders mutually trampled contended Xiang Wang, mutually killed several ten people.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Yi took his head, remaining riders mutually trampled contended Xiang Wang, mutually killed several ten people. (translated).

context.previous: 乃自刎而死。
context.next: 最其後，郎中騎楊喜，騎司馬呂馬童，郎中呂勝、楊武各得其一體。

translations.chinese: 最其後，郎中騎楊喜，騎司馬呂馬童，郎中呂勝、楊武各得其一體。
translations.literal: Finally, court gentleman rider Yang Xi, cavalry adjutant Lu Matong, court gentleman Lu Sheng, Yang Wu each got one part.
translations.idiomatic: Finally, court gentleman rider Yang Xi, cavalry adjutant Lu Matong, court gentleman Lu Sheng, Yang Wu each got one part. (translated).

context.previous: 王翳取其頭，餘騎相蹂踐爭項王，相殺者數十人。
context.next: 五人共會其體，皆是。

translations.chinese: 五人共會其體，皆是。
translations.literal: Five people together assembled his body, all correct.
translations.idiomatic: Five people together assembled his body, all correct. (translated).

context.previous: 最其後，郎中騎楊喜，騎司馬呂馬童，郎中呂勝、楊武各得其一體。
context.next: 故分其地為五：封呂馬童為中水侯，封王翳為杜衍侯，封楊喜為赤泉侯，封楊武為吳防侯，封呂勝為涅陽侯。

translations.chinese: 故分其地為五：封呂馬童為中水侯，封王翳為杜衍侯，封楊喜為赤泉侯，封楊武為吳防侯，封呂勝為涅陽侯。
translations.literal: Therefore divided his lands into five: enfeoffed Lu Matong as Zhongshui Hou, enfeoffed Wang Yi as Duyan Hou, enfeoffed Yang Xi as Chiquan Hou, enfeoffed Yang Wu as Wufang Hou, enfeoffed Lu Sheng as Nieyang Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore divided his lands into five: enfeoffed Lu Matong as Zhongshui Hou, enfeoffed Wang Yi as Duyan Hou, enfeoffed Yang Xi as Chiquan Hou, enfeoffed Yang Wu as Wufang Hou, enfeoffed Lu Sheng as Nieyang Hou. (translated).

context.previous: 五人共會其體，皆是。

translations.chinese: 項王已死，楚地皆降漢，獨魯不下。
translations.literal: Xiang Wang already dead, Chu lands all surrendered Han, only Lu not submitted.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang already dead, Chu lands all surrendered Han, only Lu not submitted. (translated).

context.next: 漢乃引天下兵欲屠之，為其守禮義，為主死節，乃持項王頭視魯，魯父兄乃降。

translations.chinese: 漢乃引天下兵欲屠之，為其守禮義，為主死節，乃持項王頭視魯，魯父兄乃降。
translations.literal: Han then led world troops wished slaughter them, because they guarded rites righteousness, for lord died loyalty, then held Xiang Wang head showed Lu, Lu fathers elders then surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: Han then led world troops wished slaughter them, because they guarded rites righteousness, for lord died loyalty, then held Xiang Wang head showed Lu, Lu fathers elders then surrendered. (translated).

context.previous: 項王已死，楚地皆降漢，獨魯不下。
context.next: 始，楚懷王初封項籍為魯公，及其死，魯最後下，故以魯公禮葬項王穀城。

translations.chinese: 始，楚懷王初封項籍為魯公，及其死，魯最後下，故以魯公禮葬項王穀城。
translations.literal: Beginning, Chu Huai Wang initially enfeoffed Xiang Ji as Lu Gong, and his death, Lu last submitted, therefore with Lu Gong rites buried Xiang Wang Gucheng.
translations.idiomatic: Beginning, Chu Huai Wang initially enfeoffed Xiang Ji as Lu Gong, and his death, Lu last submitted, therefore with Lu Gong rites buried Xiang Wang Gucheng. (translated).

context.previous: 漢乃引天下兵欲屠之，為其守禮義，為主死節，乃持項王頭視魯，魯父兄乃降。
context.next: 漢王為發哀，泣之而去。

translations.chinese: 漢王為發哀，泣之而去。
translations.literal: Han Wang for him issued mourning, wept and left.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang for him issued mourning, wept and left. (translated).

context.previous: 始，楚懷王初封項籍為魯公，及其死，魯最後下，故以魯公禮葬項王穀城。

translations.chinese: 諸項氏枝屬，漢王皆不誅。
translations.literal: Various Xiang clan branches relatives, Han Wang all not executed.
translations.idiomatic: Various Xiang clan branches relatives, Han Wang all not executed. (translated).

context.next: 乃封項伯為射陽侯。

translations.chinese: 乃封項伯為射陽侯。
translations.literal: Then enfeoffed Xiang Bo as Sheyang Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Then enfeoffed Xiang Bo as Sheyang Hou. (translated).

context.previous: 諸項氏枝屬，漢王皆不誅。
context.next: 桃侯、平皋侯、玄武侯皆項氏，賜姓劉。

translations.chinese: 桃侯、平皋侯、玄武侯皆項氏，賜姓劉。
translations.literal: Tao Hou, Pinggao Hou, Xuanwu Hou all Xiang clan, granted surname Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Tao Hou, Pinggao Hou, Xuanwu Hou all Xiang clan, granted surname Liu. (translated).

context.previous: 乃封項伯為射陽侯。

translations.chinese: 太史公曰：吾聞之周生曰「舜目蓋重瞳子」，又聞項羽亦重瞳子。
translations.literal: Grand Scribe said: I heard from Zhou Sheng said 'Shun eyes probably double pupil', again heard Xiang Yu also double pupil.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Scribe said: I heard from Zhou Sheng said 'Shun eyes probably double pupil', again heard Xiang Yu also double pupil. (translated).

context.next: 羽豈其苗裔邪？

translations.chinese: 羽豈其苗裔邪？
translations.literal: Yu perhaps his descendants?
translations.idiomatic: Yu perhaps his descendants? (translated).

context.next: 何興之暴也！

translations.chinese: 何興之暴也！
translations.literal: What rise so fierce!
translations.idiomatic: What rise so fierce! (translated).

context.previous: 羽豈其苗裔邪？
context.next: 夫秦失其政，陳涉首難，豪傑蜂起，相與并爭，不可勝數。

translations.chinese: 夫秦失其政，陳涉首難，豪傑蜂起，相與并爭，不可勝數。
translations.literal: Now Qin lost its governance, Chen She first rebelled, heroes swarmed rise, mutually united contended, cannot count.
translations.idiomatic: Now Qin lost its governance, Chen She first rebelled, heroes swarmed rise, mutually united contended, cannot count. (translated).

context.previous: 何興之暴也！
context.next: 然羽非有尺寸，乘執起隴畝之中，三年，遂將五諸侯滅秦，分裂天下，而封王侯，政由羽出，號為「霸王」，位雖不終，近古以來未嘗有也。

translations.chinese: 然羽非有尺寸，乘執起隴畝之中，三年，遂將五諸侯滅秦，分裂天下，而封王侯，政由羽出，號為「霸王」，位雖不終，近古以來未嘗有也。
translations.literal: Yet Yu not had inch, rode plow rose fields middle, three years, then led five feudal lords extinguished Qin, split world, and enfeoffed kings marquises, government from Yu out, titled 'Hegemon King', position though not ended, near ancient since never had.
translations.idiomatic: Yet Yu not had inch, rode plow rose fields middle, three years, then led five feudal lords extinguished Qin, split world, and enfeoffed kings marquises, government from Yu out, titled 'Hegemon King', position though not ended, near ancient since never had. (translated).

context.previous: 夫秦失其政，陳涉首難，豪傑蜂起，相與并爭，不可勝數。
context.next: 及羽背關懷楚，放逐義帝而自立，怨王侯叛己，難矣。

translations.chinese: 及羽背關懷楚，放逐義帝而自立，怨王侯叛己，難矣。
translations.literal: When Yu turned against passes longed Chu, banished Righteous Emperor and self established, resented kings marquises rebelled him, difficult.
translations.idiomatic: When Yu turned against passes longed Chu, banished Righteous Emperor and self established, resented kings marquises rebelled him, difficult. (translated).

context.previous: 然羽非有尺寸，乘執起隴畝之中，三年，遂將五諸侯滅秦，分裂天下，而封王侯，政由羽出，號為「霸王」，位雖不終，近古以來未嘗有也。
context.next: 自矜功伐，奮其私智而不師古，謂霸王之業，欲以力征經營天下，五年卒亡其國，身死東城，尚不覺寤而不自責，過矣。

translations.chinese: 自矜功伐，奮其私智而不師古，謂霸王之業，欲以力征經營天下，五年卒亡其國，身死東城，尚不覺寤而不自責，過矣。
translations.literal: Self boasted merit achievements, exerted his private wisdom and not followed ancient, considered hegemon king enterprise, wished with force conquest managed world, five years finally perished his state, body died Dongcheng, still not aware awoke and not self blamed, mistake.
translations.idiomatic: Self boasted merit achievements, exerted his private wisdom and not followed ancient, considered hegemon king enterprise, wished with force conquest managed world, five years finally perished his state, body died Dongcheng, still not aware awoke and not self blamed, mistake. (translated).

context.previous: 及羽背關懷楚，放逐義帝而自立，怨王侯叛己，難矣。
context.next: 乃引「天亡我，非用兵之罪也」，豈不謬哉！

translations.chinese: 乃引「天亡我，非用兵之罪也」，豈不謬哉！
translations.literal: Then cited 'Heaven destroys me, not using troops crime', how not mistaken!
translations.idiomatic: Then cited 'Heaven destroys me, not using troops crime', how not mistaken! (translated).
